meanings.definition: The act of plundering or destroying
meanings.sent1: The despoliation of the ancient artifacts left the museum in disarray.
meanings.sent2: The despoliation of the forest by loggers caused irreversible damage to the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The despoliation of the picnic basket by hungry squirrels was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The despoliation of trust in their relationship left a void that could not be filled.
meanings.sent5: The despoliation of the once vibrant city turned it into a ghost town.

meanings.definition: The state of being despoiled or ruined
meanings.sent1: The despoliation of the land after the hurricane was heartbreaking.
meanings.sent2: The despoliation of her dreams left her feeling lost and hopeless.
meanings.sent3: The despoliation of the cake after the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The despoliation of innocence in the novel was a central theme.
meanings.sent5: The despoliation of the garden in winter made it seem lifeless.
